question: Vapour pressure of a solution containing 18 g of glucose and 178.2 g of water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C$</katex> is:
(Vapour pressure of pure water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C=760$</katex> torr) [cite: 306-307]
explanation: Moles glucose = 18/180 = 0.1. Moles water = 178.2/18 = 9.9. Mole fraction water = 9.9/10 = 0.99. VP solution = 0.99 * 760 = 752.4 torr. [cite: 310, 313]
